short_summary: The National Research Council Canada has a requirement for the supply of quantity 1 Differential Scanning Calorimeter (DSC) and 1 Thermogravimetric Analysis (TGA).
description: The DSC is employed to analyze thermal properties of polymers, composites and various materials and must feature modulated temperature to separate overlapping transitions and complex thermal events. The TGA is employed to monitor the changing of the mass of a sample material over time as the temperature changes. **Key Feature Requirements of the DSC and TGA instruments:**
- DSC: employed to analyze thermal properties of polymers, composites and various materials (modulated temperature to separate overlapping transitions and complex thermal events)
- TGA: monitors the changing of the mass of a sample material over time while the temperature changes (investigates degradation mechanisms, reaction kinetics and determines organic and inorganic content in a sample)
